law.full_text:
PRESENT AT GAMBLING. (Added by Ord. No. 111,074, Eff. 5/3/58).
It shall be unlawful for any person knowingly to visit, frequent, or be present at or within any house, room, apartment, stand or place used in whole or in part as a gambling house, or any place where any game is played, conducted, dealt or carried on with cards, dice, or other device for money, checks, chips, credit, pennants, cigars, candy, merchandise or other valuable thing, or representative of value; provided, however, this ordinance shall not apply to any police officer while in the exercise of his duties as such officer, nor to any person whose presence in any such place is necessary in the course of his lawful business.

unit.catch_line: Coin Games And Similar Contrivances – Possession Prohibited.
Games – Unlawful Possession – Declared To Be A Nuisance.
Employers – Requiring Employees To Wear Service Uniforms.

law.plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE
PRESENT AT GAMBLING. (§ 43.13.2)
PRESENT AT GAMBLING. (Added by Ord. No. 111,074, Eff. 5/3/58). It shall be unlawful for any person knowingly to visit, frequent, or be present at or within any house, room, apartment, stand or place used in whole or in part as a gambling house, or any place where any game is played, conducted, dealt or carried on with cards, dice, or other device for money, checks, chips, credit, pennants, cigars, candy, merchandise or other valuable thing, or representative of value; provided, however, this ordinance shall not apply to any police officer while in the exercise of his duties as such officer, nor to any person whose presence in any such place is necessary in the course of his lawful business.
